173.article_body: Pankaj Bhasin, an Indian-origin man called 'werewolf killer' after stabbing a US man 50 times due to a psychiatric break four years ago, recently joined a dating site. After taking note, a US court ordered him to stay off social media till he's on conditional release. Bhasin is free on conditional release after spending three years in mental health facility.

174.title: Boeing will not sell 737 Max jets to China, to find new buyers
174.article_body: Boeing said it will not deliver some Boeing 737 Max jets that were built for Chinese airlines as China's aviation regulator has not cleared the plane to fly after two fatal crashes. It will instead find new buyers. Boeing had an inventory of 290 undelivered 737s as of June 30, out of which almost half was earmarked for China.

175.title: YouTuber Savukku Shankar gets 6-month jail for calling judiciary corrupt
175.article_body: Holding popular YouTuber Savukku Shankar guilty of criminal contempt for his remarks against the judiciary, the Madras High Court on Thursday sentenced him to six months imprisonment. In an interview, Shankar had said that the "entire higher judiciary is plagued by corruption". The judges said that they would have spared him had he realised his mistake and sincerely apologised.

176.title: I'm proud of breaking up with Kanye, he had a lot to work on: Julia
176.article_body: Actress-model Julia Fox said she is proud of breaking up with rapper Kanye West, adding he has a lot of unresolved issues he was dealing with. "It just seems like he had a lot to work on...I just don't have time for it," she added. Julia further said she would have stuck it out before the birth of her son.

177.title: Pakistan is moving around with a begging bowl in hand today: Pakistan PM
177.article_body: Pakistan Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif publicly admitted that his country is moving around with a begging bowl in hand today as it has failed to progress economically despite 75 years of independence. "Today, when we go to any friendly country or make a phone call, they think that we have come to beg for money," he said.

178.title: Manipur CM appeals for peace talks as 13 insurgents lay down arms
178.article_body: Manipur CM N Biren Singh on Thursday appealed to all militant outfits to come for peace talks after 13 insurgents surrendered before him in Imphal. Of the insurgents who surrendered, 12 were from KCP-PWG and one was from KYKL. The militants laid down arms, including two grenade launchers, three pistols, two detonators and two radio sets, among others, PTI reported.

179.title: I've always compared Mahmudullah with MS Dhoni: Ex-India bowler Sriram
179.article_body: Ex-India bowler and Bangladesh coach Sridharan Sriram said he's "always compared" Mahmudullah Riyad with MS Dhoni considering his performances. "Mahmudullah...finished a lot of matches for Bangladesh," added Sriram. Talking about his conversation with Mahmudullah over not being a part of Bangladesh's squad for T20 World Cup 2022, Sriram stated, "It is never...easy...I've to be the bad man."

180.title: GMDA to construct road overbridge at Gurugram's Palam Vihar
180.article_body: The Gurugram Metropolitan Development Authority (GMDA) will construct a road overbridge connecting Gurugram's Palam Vihar and Sector 102 road with the Dwarka expressway. Residents living in Palam Vihar, Sectors 21, 22 and 23, along with people travelling from Delhi to Udyog Vihar and beyond will benefit from the project. The overbridge will be built at a cost of ₹68 crore.

181.title: Ex-US teacher charged with sex crimes after posting TikToks of students
181.article_body: A former elementary school teacher in US' Tennessee has been charged with 19 sex crimes, including rape and sexual battery by an authority figure, after allegedly posting inappropriate videos of her students on TikTok. However, the exact content of the videos has not been revealed yet. Taylor Cruze, who resigned as a fifth-grade teacher in May, was arrested in August.

182.title: Telugu industry is dominated by film families & their fans: Amala Paul
182.article_body: Speaking about leaving the Telugu film industry, actress Amala Paul stated that it is dominated by film families and their fans. "There would always be two actresses and we'd be there for the love scenes, songs and everything was very glamorous," the actress added. She further said they were very commercial films and she couldn't connect much with the industry.

183.title: J&K to declare Maharaja Hari Singh's birthday a public holiday
183.article_body: The birth anniversary of Maharaja Hari Singh, the last ruler of the erstwhile princely state of Jammu and Kashmir, will be declared a public holiday, according to an official statement. Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha announced the decision after meeting with prominent political leaders, civil society members and others. Singh was a great educationist and a social reformer, said Sinha.

184.title: I told Babar 'Don't take up captaincy, reach Kohli's level first': Kamran
184.article_body: Sharing his conversation with Babar Azam after Babar was named as Pakistan's captain, Pakistan wicketkeeper-batter Kamran Akmal said, "I told him, 'I don't think now is the right time for you to become captain'." "Reach Virat Kohli's level first...I told him back in the day but it was his decision," added Kamran elaborating on his advice to Babar.

185.title: CBI seeks WB leader Partha's custody in recruitment scam case
185.article_body: The CBI has filed a plea in a Kolkata court seeking custody of former West Bengal Education Minister Partha Chatterjee in connection with the teachers' recruitment scam. "During interrogation, the five persons arrested by our officers revealed a lot of information, which clearly points at the role of the former Education Minister in the matter," said a CBI official.

186.title: I was listed as a billionaire, it pissed me off: Founder who donated US-based firm
186.article_body: Patagonia Founder Yvon Chouinard, who has donated his US-based company to fight climate change, said, "I was in Forbes magazine listed as a billionaire, which really, really pissed me off." The 83-year-old told The New York Times, "I don't have $1 billion in...bank. I don't drive Lexuses." Chouinard founded Patagonia 49 years ago and is valued at $3 billion today.

187.title: Hyderabad Metro was initially written off as a foolish idea, says MD
187.article_body: Hyderabad Metro Managing Director NVS Reddy on Thursday said, "The metro projects were originally written off by many experts as a foolish idea and a jinxed project." He was speaking as the Chief Guest at an Engineer's Day event at Anurag University. Citing the metro's example, Reddy encouraged students to be innovative, confident and to learn to face challenges.

188.title: Unfortunate, but he's happy: Nagarjuna on Samantha-Naga Chaitanya divorce
188.article_body: Veteran actor Nagarjuna has called his son Naga Chaitanya's divorce with actress Samantha Ruth Prabhu unfortunate, saying that it's an experience that happened to his son. "We can't keep moping about it. It's gone. It's out of our lives," the actor said. Nagarjuna further said his son is happy and that's all he sees, adding that's good enough for him.

189.title: 7-yr-old dies after falling into pit at Pune construction site; 4 booked
189.article_body: A seven-year-old boy died after falling into a pit filled with rainwater at a construction site in Pune's Wagholi. The deceased's uncle on Wednesday lodged the first information report (FIR) at the Lonikand Police Station. Police have booked four persons of a construction firm under various sections of the Indian Penal Code.

190.title: Blake Lively, Ryan Reynolds expecting their 4th child; pic shows actress with baby bump
190.article_body: Hollywood actress Blake Lively and actor Ryan Reynolds, who have three daughters James (7), Inez (5), and Betty (2), are expecting their fourth child. Pictures from Blake's appearance at the Forbes Power Women's Summit showed her with a baby bump. "I just like to create. Whether that's baking or storytelling or businesses or humans," the actress said at the event.

191.title: Hydrogen-powered trains to be ready by 2023: Railways Minister
191.article_body: Railways Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw while speaking at a university in Odisha's Bhubaneswar, said on Thursday that India is developing hydrogen-powered trains and they will be ready by next year. He also added that the Vande Bharat Express, which is the country's first indigenous semi-high speed train, "has been running smoothly without any major breakdown for the last two years".

192.title: Jimmy Neesham declines New Zealand central contract
192.article_body: All-rounder Jimmy Neesham has declined a central contract offered to him by New Zealand Cricket. "I know...news of my decision to decline a central contract...will be seen as me choosing money over representing my country," Neesham said. He added, "I had planned to accept...offer in July...however since being left off the list I've committed to other leagues around the world."

193.title: Sensex falls 400 points, Nifty below 17,800 in opening trade
193.article_body: The benchmark indices opened in the red on Friday amid weak global cues. The Sensex fell over 400 points to trade at 59,533, while the Nifty lost over 100 points to open below 17,800. Tech Mahindra, M&M, Wipro, Maruti Suzuki, Infosys and TCS were among the major losers. Stocks of Sun Pharma, Bajaj Finance and Asian Paints gained.

194.title: Supplying weapons to Ukraine morally acceptable: Pope Francis
194.article_body: Pope Francis said that it is "morally acceptable" for countries to provide weapons to Ukraine to help the country defend itself from Russian aggression. "It can be immoral if the intention is provoking more war," he added. Pope also urged Ukraine to be open to dialogue, even though it may "smell" because it would be difficult for the Ukrainian side.

195.title: India reports 6,298 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 46,748
195.article_body: India has reported 6,298 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. The data showed that 5,916 people recovered in the last 24 hours following which the active COVID-19 cases in the country dropped to 46,748. This comes a day after 6,422 new COVID-19 cases were reported in India.

196.title: Bodies of 440 people found in a grave in city recaptured from Russia by Ukraine
196.article_body: Ukrainian authorities have found bodies of over 440 people in a grave in the city of Izium that was recaptured from Russian forces. Serhiy Bolvinov, the chief police investigator for Kharkiv region, said that forensic investigations would be carried out on every body. "Russia is leaving death behind it everywhere and must be held responsible," Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said.

197.title: COVID-19 cases in B'luru rise marginally to 283, 1 death reported
197.article_body: Bengaluru reported 283 new COVID-19 infections on Thursday, up from 261 seen a day before, taking the cumulative total to 18,69,524 cases, said BBMP Chief Commissioner. One more patient died of the infection, taking the total death toll to 16,987 in the city. The number of active cases was 2,463, while the infection positivity rate stood at 2.07%.

198.title: 9, including 3 minors, killed in Lucknow's Dilkusha as wall collapses amid heavy rain
198.article_body: As many as nine people, including three minors, were killed and two others were injured after a wall collapsed amid heavy rain in Lucknow. The incident took place in Dilkusha under Cantt, the state Home Department said. UP CM Yogi Adityanath has announced financial assistance of ₹4 lakh each to the families of the deceased.

199.title: Trader attacked, robbed in Delhi's Adarsh Nagar; 2 arrested
199.article_body: Two people have been arrested for attacking and robbing a 52-year-old trader in Delhi's Adarsh Nagar area on Wednesday. According to police, Harpreet Singh was walking towards his car when four assailants attacked him and robbed him of ₹34,500 in cash, along with his mobile phone and some cards. Police recovered robbed amount worth ₹16,500 from the accused's possession.

200.title: Burglar wanted in 20 cases held in Navi Mumbai; ₹28 lakh-gold recovered
200.article_body: Gold worth ₹28 lakh was recovered after a burglar who was wanted in 20 house break-in cases was arrested in Navi Mumbai, CP Bipin Kumar Singh said. The accused was traced after the weight of the gold he stole constantly caused his pants to slip off, which forced him to hire an auto from a stand that had CCTV.

201.title: Fire breaks out at chemical research centre in Hyderabad
201.article_body: A fire broke out at a chemical research centre in Hyderabad's Nacharam on Thursday. About 300 litres of chemicals were said to have been burnt in the incident, however, no casualties were reported. Three fire engines were deployed to contain the blaze. This comes days after a fire at an e-bike showroom in the city claimed eight lives.

202.title: Not inviting Russia to Queen Elizabeth II's funeral blasphemous: Moscow
202.article_body: Russia has described the UK's decision not to invite its representatives to Queen Elizabeth II's funeral as "blasphemous". "We see this British attempt to use the national tragedy...for geopolitical purposes to settle scores with our country...as deeply immoral," Russia's Foreign Ministry said. Relations between the two countries have been at a breaking point since Moscow began invading Ukraine.

203.title: Queen's relative faints as her coffin arrives in Westminster Hall; pic surfaces
203.article_body: UK Queen Elizabeth II's relative Lady Gabriella Windsor collapsed as the Queen's coffin arrived at the Westminster Hall for service. Lady Gabriella Windsor was seen being assisted to a seat by several people present at the service. Earlier, a Royal guard fainted and fell off the podium where he was protecting the Queen's coffin.

204.title: Building's wall falls on tin shed in Pimpri Chinchwad; 2 dead
204.article_body: Two people have died after a portion of a building's wall fell on the adjacent tin shed, in which they both were, during plastering work on Thursday in Pimpri Chinchwad's Moshi. A senior inspector said that two labourers who had climbed a bamboo structure for the plastering work were also injured during the incident when the structure collapsed.

205.title: NTA announces Common University Entrance Test-UG 2022 results
205.article_body: National Testing Agency (NTA) has announced the results of the first Common University Entrance Test-Undergraduate (CUET-UG) 2022. Students can check their scorecards at cuet.samarth.ac.in. NTA conducted CUET-UG 2022 in six phases in July-August at 489 centres in 259 cities across India. CUET is conducted for admission to undergraduate courses at central and other participating universities.

206.title: $30 billion wiped off Adobe's market value after $20 billion deal to buy Figma
206.article_body: Shares of Adobe plunged nearly 17% after the Photoshop maker announced a $20 billion cash and stock deal to buy online design startup Figma on Thursday. The biggest plunge in the company's stock since 2010 wiped out more than $30 billion from Adobe's market value. The deal has sparked some concerns among investors who argued that Adobe overpaid for Figma.

207.title: Elon Musk's ex-girlfriend auctions their college photos, gifts for over ₹1.3 crore
207.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk's ex-girlfriend Jennifer Gwynne has raised over $165,000 (₹1.3 crore) from the auction of photos and memorabilia gifted to her by Musk during their year-long relationship in 1994-95. A gold necklace with a green emerald that Musk gave to Gwynne as a birthday present sold for $51,000, whereas Musk's previously unseen photographs sold for up to $21,000.

208.title: Putin laughs as Pak PM struggles with headphones during meeting; video surfaces
208.article_body: A video showing Russian President Vladimir Putin laughing as Pakistan Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif struggles with headphones during bilateral talks has surfaced on social media. The video, which was shared by former Pakistan PM Imran Khan's party PTI, also showed Sharif asking an aide for help. Putin laughed as the device fell off Sharif's ear.

209.title: Parts of Bengaluru's Nalapad Academy demolished over encroachment
209.article_body: Days after the city witnessed massive flooding, the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) on Wednesday demolished parts of Nalapad Academy, an international school near Embassy Golf Links Business Park. The school, owned by Congress MLA NA Haris, faced allegations of encroachment. Officials said that storm water drain passes through a part of the property.

210.title: Delhi AAP MLA Amanatullah Khan summoned by anti-corruption branch
210.article_body: The anti-corruption branch (ACB) issued a notice to Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) leader Amanatullah Khan over allegations of illegal appointment in the Delhi Waqf Board. The Okhla MLA was called for questioning on Friday afternoon in connection with the Prevention of Corruption Act, 1988 case registered in 2020. ACB is probing alleged irregularities in recruitment in the Delhi Waqf board.

211.title: BMC to conduct sero-survey in Mumbai from Sept 15 to Oct 6
211.article_body: The BMC will conduct a sero-survey in Mumbai from September 15 to October 6, in order to check COVID-19 antibodies among healthcare and frontline workers. The civic body aims to collect 3,094 samples from 93 places and people, including hospitals, solid waste department and BEST employees. "It'll...help...understand the significance of the third dose of COVID-19 vaccine," an official said.

212.title: Croma Early Bird Sale offers daily deals on all electronics
212.article_body: Croma welcomes the festive season 2022 with its Early Bird Sale from 14th to 18th September. New deals are offered on Croma website and store every day on iPhones, Android smartphones, smartwatches, televisions & other electronics, for a limited period only. HDFC credit card users can avail up to 10% instant discount* and EasyEMI*.

213.title: Passenger with ₹88 lakh foreign currency in laptop bag held at Delhi airport
213.article_body: Central Industrial Security Force (CISF) officials nabbed a passenger carrying foreign currency worth approximately ₹88 lakh at Delhi's Indira Gandhi International Airport. The passenger had concealed the currency under a false layer in a 'laptop bag', CISF said while posting a video of the operation. The passenger was later handed over to customs officials.

214.title: 38-year-old ambulance driver shot dead in Delhi
214.article_body: A 38-year-old man, who worked as an ambulance driver, was shot dead on Thursday morning in South West Delhi, police said. Sunil was returning home from work on a motorcycle when two unidentified people, who were also riding a motorcycle, allegedly shot him. The murder was reported in Jaffarpur Kalan area on a road connecting Samaspur Khalsa and Kazipur villages.

215.title: BMTC planning to induct 10 double-decker AC electric buses
215.article_body: Bengaluru Metropolitan Transport Corporation (BMTC) is planning to induct 10 double-decker air-conditioned electric buses, said BMTC Director AV Surya Sen. "Of the 10, amount (for procurement) has been sanctioned for five. We are also in the process of identifying the routes," Sen added. The electric buses are likely to be operated on Outer Ring Road and other peripheral roads.

216.title: Australia's Rachael Haynes, who won 6 World Cups, retires from international cricket
216.article_body: Australia Women batter Rachael Haynes has announced her retirement from international cricket at the age of 35. She played six Tests, 77 ODIs and 84 T20Is in her career. She was part of Australia Women's 2010, 2012, 2018 and 2020 T20 World Cup-winning squads. She also won two ODI World Cups (2013 and 2022).

217.title: Your tennis became a habit and habits never retire: Sachin Tendulkar to Roger Federer
217.article_body: Penning a note on Roger Federer's retirement, Sachin Tendulkar wrote, "What a career, @rogerfederer. We fell in love with your brand of tennis." He added, "Slowly, your tennis became a habit. And habits never retire, they become a part of us." Sachin further wrote, "Thank you for all the wonderful memories." Federer won 20 Grand Slams during his career.

218.title: Dalit sisters were raped, strangulated in Lakhimpur Kheri: Autopsy report
218.article_body: The post-mortem report of the two Dalit girls who were found hanging from a tree in Uttar Pradesh's Lakhimpur Kheri has confirmed that they were raped and murdered, police said. The report stated that the minor girls died due to strangulation. Police said that the accused hanged the victims to eliminate evidence of murder. Police have arrested six accused.

219.title: I wish this day would have never come: Rafael Nadal on Roger Federer's retirement
219.article_body: Reacting to Roger Federer announcing his retirement, Rafael Nadal tweeted, "Dear Roger, my friend and rival. I wish this day would have never come." He added, "It's a sad day for me personally and for sports around the world." He further wrote, "It's been a pleasure but also an honour and privilege to share all these years with you."

220.title: Chief selector's cheap selection: Mohammad Amir on Pakistan's T20 World Cup 2022 squad
220.article_body: Pakistani pacer Mohammad Amir took to Twitter to react to Pakistan's squad for T20 World Cup 2022 that was announced today. "Chief selector ki cheap selection (Chief selector's cheap selection)," he wrote. Reacting to it, a fan wrote, "You just sit and watch...Champions Trophy highlights." Amir announced his retirement from international cricket in December 2020 due to then PCB management.

221.title: 'Everybody fixing their bodies, nobody fixing their souls,' writes Deepika in new post
221.article_body: Actress Deepika Padukone on Wednesday shared a post featuring pictures from Mijwan 2022, where she walked the ramp. Sharing the post, she wrote in the caption, "It's the last one for me." The last part of the post read, "Everybody is fixing their bodies, nobody fixing their souls." Reacting to this, an Instagram user commented, "Last slide is so true!"

222.title: Will give ED list of 100 TMC leaders with disproportionate assets: BJP MLA
222.article_body: BJP MLA Suvendu Adhikari on Thursday stated that he would soon submit documents to the ED that contain details about "disproportionate assets" of 100 Trinamool Congress (TMC) leaders. "A few days back, [West Bengal] CM Mamata Banerjee...claimed that 99% of party workers are honest. But, I've documents to prove [that] nearly 99% of TMC leaders are corrupt," Adhikari claimed.

223.title: Wife, lover electrocutes 26-year-old man to death in Maha; arrested
223.article_body: A 21-year-old woman, her lover and one more person have been arrested in connection with the murder of a 26-year-old lawyer in Maharashtra's Jalna, police said. Kiran Lokhande was killed after his wife and her lover allegedly gave him sleeping pills before electrocuting him. The accused had claimed that Kiran was killed in a blaze caused by gas leakage.

224.title: 16 TDP legislators suspended from Andhra Pradesh Assembly
224.article_body: Sixteen legislators of Telugu Desam Party (TDP) were suspended for a day in the Andhra Pradesh Legislative Assembly on Thursday for protesting in the Well of the House. The TDP members had allegedly taken offence to purported remarks made by Social Welfare Minister M Nagarjuna on Dalit MLA DBV Swamy. Minister Nagarjuna maintained he had said nothing wrong.

225.title: Speaking Hindi gives me shivers, I speak it with hesitation: FM
225.article_body: At an event organised by Hindi Vivek magazine on Thursday, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said, "Addressing an audience in Hindi gives me shivers...I speak Hindi with...'sankoch' (hesitation)." She added that she attended college in Tamil Nadu amid an agitation against Hindi. Students opting for Hindi as the second language did not get scholarships by the state government then, she claimed.

226.title: Astronomers find evidence of Neptune or Saturn-like 'baby' planet in making
226.article_body: Astronomers believe planets are born in protoplanetary disks. Using a new technique, they have found evidence of a baby planet in the making in one such protoplanetary disk known as LkCa 15, located 518 light years away from Earth. The baby planet is roughly the size of Neptune or Saturn and around one to three million years old, astronomers stated.

227.title: China's Xi and Russia's Putin meet in Uzbekistan, discuss ties
227.article_body: Chinese President Xi Jinping and Russia’s Vladimir Putin discussed enhancing bilateral ties on the sidelines of the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation summit in Uzbekistan on Thursday. Putin launched a veiled criticism of the US, saying “attempts to create a unipolar world" have taken an "ugly shape". Xi said Russia and China will play a leading role in a "rapidly changing world".

228.title: AI startup Rephrase.ai raises $10.6 mn in Series A funding round
228.article_body: Artificial Intelligence startup Rephrase.ai, backed by Lightspeed Ventures, has raised $10.6 million in its Series A funding round. The round was led by Red Ventures and saw participation from Silver Lake and 8VC Ventures, among other investors. Founded in 2019 by IIT alumni Ashray Malhotra, Nisheeth Lahoti and Shivam Mangla, the startup is a synthetic media production platform.

229.title: US singer R Kelly convicted of child pornography charge
229.article_body: US singer R Kelly has been convicted of child pornography by a jury in Chicago. Of the 13 counts on trial, Kelly was found guilty on six counts. A count of child pornography carries a minimum sentence of five years in Chicago. Kelly is already serving a 30-year prison sentence after conviction in racketeering and sex trafficking charges.

230.title: IIT alumni's US-based startup raises $90 mn in funding round
230.article_body: Fortanix Inc, a US-based data security startup founded by IIT graduates, has raised $90 million in its Series C funding round led by Goldman Sachs Group Inc fund. The round also saw participation from Giantleap Capital and existing investors such as Intel Capital. The startup was founded in 2016 by IIT Kanpur alumni Ambuj Kumar and Anand Kashyap.

231.title: Indian-American Shefali Duggal appointed US' Ambassador to the Netherlands
231.article_body: Indian-American political activist Shefali Razdan Duggal has been appointed the US' next Ambassador to the Netherlands. Duggal's nomination was confirmed by the US Senate in a voice vote. Duggal, 50, is a Kashmiri Pandit. She was born in Haridwar and shifted to Pennsylvania, US, with her family when she was two years old.

232.title: UK to observe 2-min national silence during Queen's state funeral
232.article_body: The UK will observe two-minute national silence during Queen Elizabeth II’s state funeral on Monday, the Buckingham Palace said. Releasing details of the funeral arrangements, the palace said Elizabeth’s coffin will be taken from Westminster Abbey to Wellington Arch on a horse-drawn gun carriage. The funeral will be attended by around 2,000 guests, including people the Queen had honoured.

233.title: NASA's supernova remnant image gives clues about its star’s death
233.article_body: Astronomers studying the remains of a supernova captured using NASA telescopes have found clues about the star's death. The supernova remnant called SNR 0519-69.0 is the debris from an explosion of a white dwarf star, which according to NASA's Chandra Ray Observatory, underwent a thermonuclear explosion after reaching critical mass. It's located in a small galaxy called Large Magellanic Cloud.

234.title: Ex-President of WBBSE Kalyanmoy Ganguly arrested in SSC scam case
234.article_body: The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) on Thursday arrested Kalyanmoy Ganguly, former President of West Bengal Board of Secondary Education (WBBSE), in connection with the state SSC recruitment scam case. Ganguly was arrested after being questioned by CBI officials. Earlier in the day, the CBI raided the offices of two software companies in connection with the case.

235.title: Gems, jewellery exports grew by 6.7% in August to ₹26,418 crore
235.article_body: The overall gems and jewellery exports grew by 6.7% in August 2022 to ₹26,418.84 crore as compared to ₹24,749.69 crore in the same period last year, the Gem and Jewellery Export Promotion Council (GJEPC) said on Thursday. However, the overall gross export of cut and polished diamonds (CPD) declined 0.84% to ₹14,955.8 crore in August.

236.title: BJP paid ₹40-50 cr to each of 8 Goa Cong MLAs: AICC Goa in-charge
236.article_body: After eight Goa Congress MLAs joined BJP, AICC Goa in-charge Dinesh Gundu Rao on Thursday accused the BJP of paying ₹40-50 crore to each legislator. "The national party (BJP) is doing such things everywhere. Where is all this money coming from?" Gundu Rao questioned. "They are misusing the power. They are breaking the elected representatives," Rao said.

237.title: Nigeria’s consumer inflation hit 17-year high in August 2022
237.article_body: The Nigerian National Bureau of Statistics on Thursday said the country's consumer inflation rose to its highest level in 17 years in August 2022. As per official data, inflation rose to 20.5% in August, up from 19.6% in July this year. This is the seventh straight month wherein Nigeria has recorded an increase in its inflation rate.

238.title: Thief dangles from train window for 10 km in Bihar as passengers grab his arms
238.article_body: A man trying to snatch a mobile phone from a train passenger through the window was left hanging outside for 10 km, apologising, as passengers grabbed his arms. The video is from Bihar and the train was reportedly nearing the end of its journey from Begusarai to Khagaria. The passengers let him go when the train was close to Khagaria.

239.title: BJP 'gifts' 5 autos to Kejriwal after his run-in with Guj police
239.article_body: Delhi BJP MLAs reached Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal's residence to offer him a 'gift' of 5 autorickshaws after his argument with Gujarat police over being stopped from getting in the three-wheeler. In Gujarat, Kejriwal had an argument with policemen in his security detail about getting into an auto owing to security concerns. Kejriwal was going to the auto driver's home.

240.title: What was gangster Lawrence Bishnoi's 'Plan B' to kill Salman Khan?
240.article_body: Members of the Goldie Brar-Lawrence Bishnoi gang had rented a room in Panvel to recce Salman Khan's farmhouse. The gangsters managed to track down the route and judging by the potholes, they surmised that the actor's car could be travelling at around 25 kmph. Bishnoi's men also befriended the security guards at the farmhouse by pretending to be his fans.

241.title: World number one Alcaraz reacts to Federer's retirement with broken heart emoji
241.article_body: World number one men's tennis player Carlos Alcaraz, who recently stated he'd like to face Roger Federer, reacted to Federer's retirement with a broken heart emoji. He tweeted, "Roger...[broken heart emoji]." In another tweet, he wrote, "Roger has been one of my idols...Thank you for everything you have done for our sport...I still want to play with you!"

242.title: Video shows monkey attending classes with kids at J'khand govt school
242.article_body: A video showing a monkey attending classes and prayer meetings with students at a Jharkhand government school has gone viral on social media. As per reports, the monkey has been attending classes for the past one week. The headmaster said that the monkey reaches the school premises when the school opens at 9:00 am and leaves after the classes end.

243.title: Shell to deploy over 10,000 EV charging points across India by 2030
243.article_body: Energy company Shell has said that it plans to install over 10,000 electric vehicle (EV) charging points across India by 2030 through Shell Recharge Stations. Shell launched its first EV chargers in India for the four-wheeler and two-wheeler segments in Bangalore on Thursday. The company said that the electricity used by Shell Recharge chargers will be 100% green energy.

244.title: Scientists claim to have discovered a rare 'dinosaur mummy' in Canada
244.article_body: Scientists claim they've discovered a rare 'dinosaur mummy' in Canada, said to be one of the most well-preserved dinosaur fossils ever found. The remains of the hadrosaur, a duck-billed, large-bodied, herbivorous dinosaur, included a large portion of its tail and right hind foot. Large parts of its exposed skeleton are covered in fossilised skin, which makes it unique, scientists said.

245.title: Interstate gang of bike thieves busted in Ambala; 3 held, 16 bikes seized
245.article_body: The Haryana Police busted an interstate gang of motorcycle thieves and arrested three accused including a mechanic from Ambala. Sixteen motorcycles were recovered from them, a police spokesperson said on Thursday. During interrogation, one of the accused confessed that he had been working as a motorcycle mechanic and stole them to raise money to pay for drugs, the spokesperson added.

246.title: Gangster Lawrence Bishnoi had 'Plan B' to kill Salman Khan: Police
246.article_body: Gangster Lawrence Bishnoi had a 'Plan B' to kill actor Salman Khan, the police in Delhi and Punjab have said. Punjab Police revealed that the plan was led by Kapil Pandit, a shooter of the Lawrence Bishnoi gang, who was recently arrested. Pandit and his associates had rented a room in Panvel to recce a farmhouse that Salman owned.

247.title: India emerges as SL's top lender in 2022, gives $377 mn loan: Report
247.article_body: According to the Verite Research think-tank, India has emerged as the top lender to Sri Lanka in 2022 as the country faced unprecedented political crisis and economic turmoil. Of the total $968 million in loans which Sri Lanka received in 2022, India reportedly contributed $377 million to the nation. The Asian Development Bank follows India with $360 million in loans.

248.title: India's 1st lithium cell manufacturing plant to be launched in AP
248.article_body: Minister of State for IT Rajeev Chandrasekhar will launch the pre-production run of India's first lithium cell manufacturing facility in Andhra Pradesh's Tirupati tomorrow. It has been set up by Munoth Industries, PIB reported. The plant's inauguration will be a step in the direction of realising the PM's vision of making India the global hub of electronic manufacturing, Chandrasekhar said.

249.title: Prohibition a complete failure, have asked Nitish Kumar to review: Kishor
249.article_body: Poll strategist Prashant Kishor on Thursday claimed that Bihar's liquor prohibition is a complete failure and said he has asked CM Nitish Kumar to review it. "[Prohibition] existing only on paper because of rampant corruption," Kishor said. Prashant Kishor also confirmed that he met CM Nitish Kumar along with former MP Pavan Varma on Tuesday.

250.title: Centre, Assam govt sign tripartite peace deal with 8 tribal outfits
250.article_body: Centre and Assam government on Thursday signed a tripartite peace deal with eight tribal outfits in presence of Union Home Minister Amit Shah. "Around 1,100 people belonging to Adivasi outfits of Assam are surrendering arms...We want Assam and...northeast [to] be drug-free [and] terrorism-free," Shah said. Centre seeks to end all border disputes in the northeast by 2024, he added.

251.title: All judges are on the same page: CJI Lalit on reports about rift among judges
251.article_body: Refuting the reports about the rift among judges of the Supreme Court regarding the new listing system of cases on Thursday, Chief Justice of India (CJI) UU Lalit said that "all judges are on the same page". "We have taken a new way of listing. What has been reported is not the correct state of affairs," he said.

252.title: Congress to pass key resolution ahead of party Prez election
252.article_body: Congress leader Madhusudan Mistry on Thursday said delegates of Pradesh Congress Committees (PCC) will pass a resolution to authorise the party's next President to appoint state chiefs. Mistry said the procedure to elect the party's next President was "open" and nothing would be hidden. Mistry said over 9,000 PCC delegates were being issued QR code-attached identity cards for the polls.

253.title: Girls, aged 2 & 4, die after family gets 'baba' to treat snake bite in Raj
253.article_body: Two sisters, aged two and four, died in Rajasthan's Dausa after their family took them to a 'baba' (quack) instead of a hospital for getting their snake bites treated. The 'baba' hit the girls' heads with brooms and gave them ritualistic ashes for three hours. After the girls showed no signs of improvement, their family took them to a hospital.

254.title: Google slashes 7 R&D projects, asks employees to find new jobs internally by Jan: Report
254.article_body: Google has slashed seven out of 14 experimental projects at its in-house R&D division called Area 120, TechCrunch reported. This comes amid Google's move to control spending and focus on projects that build on its "deep investment" in AI, a spokesperson stated. Affected employees will reportedly need to find new jobs within Google by January 2023 or lose their jobs.

255.title: Will not step down unless asked by RJD: Bihar Agri Minister
255.article_body: Bihar Agriculture Minister Sudhakar Singh, who accused the state Agriculture Department of corruption, on Thursday said that CM Nitish Kumar could sack him but he'll not step down unless asked to do so by his party. The RJD leader stated, "The final decision about the fate of my ministerial berth will be taken by...[RJD leaders] Lalu Prasad Yadav and...Tejashwi Yadav."

256.title: AAP leaders protest after police stop visit to landfill in Delhi
256.article_body: A group of Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) leaders on Thursday alleged they were stopped from visiting the Okhla landfill, which is under Municipal Corporation of Delhi. Led by MLA Saurabh Bharadwaj, the group later protested and raised slogans against the BJP. AAP is taking up visits to garbage hills across the city to highlight "failures" of the BJP-controlled municipal body.

257.title: Mizoram CM Zoramthanga meets Defence Minister Rajnath Singh
257.article_body: Mizoram CM Zoramthanga met Defence Minister Rajnath Singh in Delhi on Thursday. "We had a good discussion on critical issues including Mizoram's strategic importance," Zoramthanga tweeted. In the meeting, Zoramthanga urged Rajnath Singh to provide a plot within the Cantonment board area in the national capital to the [Mizoram] state government, an official statement said.

258.title: Biden administration appointed 130 Indian-Americans: US official
258.article_body: The US administration, led by President Joe Biden, has so far appointed 130 Indian-Americans to key posts, said Raj Panjabi, a senior member of the White House National Security Council. "I'm proud to be part of an administration that is committed to diversity," he said. Panjabi made the comments during an 'Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsava' event at the US Capitol.

259.title: Institutes have power to prescribe uniforms, hijab issue is different: SC
259.article_body: Supreme Court on Thursday said that educational institutes have the power to prescribe uniforms, however, it also noted that the hijab issue is different. A bench comprising Justices Hemant Gupta and Sudhanshu Dhulia has been hearing a batch of petitions challenging the ban on wearing hijab in institutes. The next hearing on the matter will be held on September 19.

260.title: Strict action should be taken: MP CM on rape of nursery student
260.article_body: Calling the sexual assault of a nursery student on the school bus a "faith-shaking" incident, Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Thursday called a meeting to give necessary directions on the matter. "Strict action should be taken against the guilty driver, female help, as well as the school management," CM Chouhan said in a tweet.

261.title: Daler Mehndi's sentence in human trafficking case suspended
261.article_body: The Punjab and Haryana High Court suspended Punjabi singer Daler Mehndi's two-year jail term after his conviction in a 2003 human trafficking case. Mehndi's lawyer Arshdeep Singh Cheema said, "His sentence has been suspended, which means that he will be out on bail, pending proceedings before the high court." Earlier, he was convicted by a trial court in 2018.

262.title: Ramdev to announce IPO plans of Patanjali Group tomorrow: Report
262.article_body: Yoga guru Baba Ramdev will reportedly announce the IPO plans of five Patanjali Group companies on Friday during a press conference. The companies are expected to be listed on the stock market within the next five years. Other than IPO plans, he'll also unveil five major policies and goals for the next five years towards achieving "Atmanirbhar Bharat (self-reliant India)".

263.title: Adobe to acquire online design startup Figma for $20 billion
263.article_body: Adobe has announced that it'll acquire online design startup Figma for $20 billion in cash and stock. Figma, founded in 2012, creates cloud-based design software that allows teams to collaborate in real time. "Approximately 6 million additional restricted stock units will be granted to Figma's CEO and employees that will vest over four years subsequent to closing," Adobe said.

264.title: India blessed to have talented pool of engineers: PM on Engineer's Day
264.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Thursday conveyed greetings to all engineers of the country on the occasion of Engineer's Day, stating that India is blessed to have a skilled and talented pool of engineers who contribute to nation-building. "Our government is working to enhance [the] infrastructure for studying engineering including building more engineering colleges," he said in a tweet.

265.title: He doesn't have in-depth knowledge: CM Khandu on Rahul Gandhi's China tweet
265.article_body: A day after Congress leader Rahul Gandhi alleged Prime Minister Narendra Modi gave 1000 sq km of territory to China without a fight, Arunachal Pradesh Chief Minister Pema Khandu on Thursday said he doesn't have in-depth knowledge. "Rahul Gandhi doesn't have much knowledge of the northeast, let alone Arunachal. He raises...issues...on which he doesn't have in-depth knowledge," Khandu said.

266.title: Stray dog killed, hanged on door in Kerala after multiple dog bite cases
266.article_body: A stray dog was killed and then publicly hanged in Kerala's Changanassery on Tuesday after the state reported multiple cases of dog bites in the past few days. A wreath was also placed close to the animal's carcass. The carcasses of 10 stray dogs were also discovered on Monday in the state's Kottayam district. Locals had reportedly poisoned the dogs.

267.title: Huge fireball spotted across the sky over Scotland, pics go viral
267.article_body: A giant 'fireball' was spotted on the night of September 14 across Scotland, clips of which were shared on social media. "There's a great deal of speculation...The evidence we have seen so far indicates space junk," tweeted UK Meteor Network. It is likely to have been space junk from Elon Musk's satellite programme, according to astronomers examining it.

268.title: How much prize money has Roger Federer won in his career?
268.article_body: Twenty-time Grand Slam champion Roger Federer, who will retire after the Laver Cup next week, has won 103 singles titles in his career. He has won 1,251 out of the 1,526 singles matches he has played so far. The 41-year-old has won a total prize money of $130,594,339 in his career. Federer had turned pro in 1998.

269.title: Google cancels 7 R&D projects, asks employees to find jobs by Jan 2023: Report
269.article_body: Google has cancelled seven out of 14 projects at its in-house research and development (R&D) division, Area 120. Google reportedly told affected employees that they'll need to find a new job within Google by end-January 2023 or they'll be terminated. "We've recently shared that Area 120 will be shifting its focus to projects that build on...AI," a Google spokesperson said.

270.title: TMC stages protest mocking Suvendu's 'Don't touch me, I'm male' remark
270.article_body: TMC on Thursday staged a protest in Kolkata against BJP's 'Nabanna Cholo' rally and carried placards mocking BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari's "Don't touch [me]..." remark. 'Modi Ji: Entire India is on sale. Nirmala Tai: All our ideas are going to fail. Suvendu: Don't touch my body, I am male', placards read. Adhikari made the comment while being detained on Tuesday.

271.title: Rahul won't gain politically from 'Bharat Jodo Yatra': Athawale
271.article_body: Union Minister Ramdas Athawale on Thursday said Rahul Gandhi will not gain politically from 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' as long as PM Modi is the Prime Minister. "The Constitution drafted by Dr BR Ambedkar has united different religions, castes and languages," Athawale said. "PM Narendra Modi is taking this forward with his 'Sabka Saath, Sabka Vikas, Sabka Vishwas' vision," he added.

272.title: ‘If a rape happens, is it CM who is doing it?’: Bihar Dy CM Tejashwi
272.article_body: Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav on Thursday criticised BJP leader Giriraj Singh and asked if the CM is involved in a crime like rape, if such an incident takes place in BJP-led states. His remarks came after Singh blamed Bihar CM Nitish Kumar for the Begusarai firing incident. "On what basis does the BJP question our law-and-order situation?" Tejashwi asked.

273.title: 57-yr-old woman falls off roof while escaping monkey attack in UP, dies
273.article_body: A 57-year-old woman, Munni, was killed after falling off a roof while escaping from a monkey attack in Uttar Pradesh's Etawah, police sources said on Thursday. The woman had gone to the roof of her house to dry clothes when she was attacked by monkeys, they said. The woman was taken to a hospital where she succumbed to her injuries.

274.title: 2 female IT professionals killed in Chennai after being hit by car running at 130 kmph
274.article_body: Two female software professionals were killed after getting hit by a speeding Honda City when they were crossing the road in Chennai's IT corridor on Wednesday night. S Lavanya and R Lakshmi, both 23, worked at HCL State Street Service. The car appeared to have run at a speed of around 130 kmph and the 20-year-old driver has surrendered.

275.title: TRS, BJP not in position to face people due to failed promises: Cong MP
275.article_body: Telangana Congress MP Uttam Kumar Reddy claimed TRS or BJP weren't in a position to face people due to the long list of failed promises. "Whenever any TRS or BJP leader enters your area, ask...about their failure to control rising prices of petrol, diesel and other...commodities," Reddy said. He claimed that Congress would retain the Munugode seat in the bypolls.

276.title: 5 kg gold seized from passenger at Kerala's Kozhikode airport, held
276.article_body: The Customs at Kerala's Calicut International Airport in Kozhikode on Thursday said they seized around 5 kg of gold worth ₹2.5 crore from a passenger who arrived from Dubai. The officials said the accused smuggled gold mixed with other metals, in connivance with two officials of a private airline. The accused and the two airline employees have been arrested.

277.title: Ukraine returned students cannot join Indian varsities: Govt to SC
277.article_body: The Centre told the Supreme Court that the students who returned from Ukraine cannot be accommodated in Indian universities as there was no provision for it in the National Medical Commission Act. The Centre said that allowing this would hamper the standards of medical education in India. Justices Hemant Gupta and Sudhanshu Dhulia will likely hear the case on Friday.

278.title: No stigma attached to word 'anaath' (orphan): Bombay HC
278.article_body: While discussing a public interest litigation (PIL), the Bombay High Court said that there is no stigma attached to the word 'anaath' or orphan and there was no need to change it. The PIL, filed by an NGO, sought that the word 'anaath' be changed to 'swanath'. The court said it was not a case for them to intervene.

279.title: 2 ICU patients die due to power cut in Karnataka hospital
279.article_body: Two patients in the ICU of Vijayanagara Institute of Medical Sciences (VIMS) hospital in Karnataka's Ballari reportedly died due to ventilator failure after a power cut in the hospital. The two patients have been identified as Maula Hussein (35), suffering from kidney-related ailments, and Chettemma (30), a snake-bite victim. VIMS, however, said the deaths were not due to power cuts.

280.title: Malware in 28 games like FIFA & PUBG exploit 3.8 lakh users: Report
280.article_body: FIFA and PUBG are among 28 games that were exploited by malware between July 2021-June 2022, affecting over 3.84 lakh users using nearly 92,000 malicious files, a report by Kaspersky researchers said. Attackers create fraudulent pages mimicking in-game stores' interface to cheat users into entering their social media login credentials. The pages offer users in-game weapons and artefacts for free.

281.title: Will wear slippers only after killers are hanged: Kanhaiya Lal's son
281.article_body: Months after Udaipur-based tailor Kanhaiya Lal was beheaded, his son said that he has sworn to wear slippers only after his father's killers are hanged. Yash Sahoo, who remains barefoot even at his workplace, has demanded the arrest of "terrorists Riyaz and Gaus Mohammad". Lal was killed for supporting suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma over her remarks against Prophet Muhammad.

282.title: Roger Federer announces his retirement from tennis
282.article_body: Twenty-time Grand Slam champion Roger Federer on Thursday announced his retirement from professional tennis aged 41. He stated the Laver Cup that will take place in London next week will be his last ATP event. "This is a bittersweet decision...because I'll miss everything the tour has given me," Federer said. Federer last played a competitive match at Wimbledon last year.

283.title: Govt to introduce subsidy to set up EV charging infrastructure: Power Secy
283.article_body: Power Secretary Alok Kumar has said the government is working to introduce a subsidy for companies that'll set up electric vehicle charging hubs across India. He said a subsidy of around ₹4-5 lakh will be provided to set up a 200-KW charging infrastructure for EVs. He added the government is working to amend the FAME II policy for the same.

284.title: TMC govt 'fascist', 'dictatorial': BJP amid West Bengal rally violence
284.article_body: The BJP on Thursday criticised the West Bengal government over violence during its protest in Kolkata, saying that TMC is working with a "fascist" and "dictatorial" mindset. WB CM Mamata Banerjee on Wednesday alleged that BJP had brought in goons for the rally and said the police could have opened fire on BJP protesters, but her government exercised restraint.

285.title: Stop embarrassing India: BJP spokesman to AAP amid BMW row
285.article_body: After German car brand BMW refuted Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann's claim that it's planning to set up a manufacturing unit in Punjab, BJP spokesperson Shehzad Poonawalla tweeted, "Kattar Liars! AAP - AUR ADHIK PROPAGANDA." He added, "Mann [and Arvind] Kejriwal…BMW manufacturing unit aapke bas ki nahi hai (it's beyond your capacity) #StopEmbarrasingIndia." Mann and Kejriwal are Aam Aadmi Party leaders.

286.title: Byju's left with 8 days to pay Blackstone ₹2,000 cr for Aakash deal
286.article_body: Edtech unicorn Byju's has eight days left to clear the remaining balance of nearly ₹2,000 crore to Blackstone as part of its Aakash acquisition deal, according to its financial report. Byju's has deferred the payment multiple times over the last few months. It will have to seek extension from the RBI if it doesn't complete the payment by September 23.

287.title: Burglar who stole only on Sundays arrested in Chennai after 2 years
287.article_body: A burglar who stole only on Sundays for the past two years because he worked in an office near Chennai on other days has been arrested, police said. The accused, M Sivachandiran, was caught near Poonamallee by authorities earlier this week after they surveilled CCTV footage. At least 10 sovereigns of gold jewellery were recovered from him, police said.

288.title: Belgian tourist looted by auto driver, 2 others during Taj Mahal tour
288.article_body: An auto driver, along with two of his aides, reportedly looted a 25-year-old Belgian tourist in Agra. According to police, the accused looted 8,000 Euros in cash, one laptop, one camera, a mobile phone and a pair of shoes from the tourist who came to see the Taj Mahal. The tourist, Sevi, a native of Goa, is working in Belgium.

289.title: UP man complains about potholes as rickshaw overturns behind him, video surfaces
289.article_body: An e-rickshaw full of passengers recently overturned in a potholed-filled stretch of UP's Ballia, as a local was describing to a reporter the plight of residents because of the poor condition of roads. He said that e-rickshaws struggle to cross the area on a regular basis, adding that commuters have suffered injuries because of potholes.

290.title: Accused in UP rape-murder of Dalit sisters shot in leg during encounter, video surfaces
290.article_body: One of the accused in the rape-murder of two teenage sisters in UP's Lakhimpur Kheri was arrested on Thursday after an encounter, in which police shot him in his leg. A video shows police bringing the injured man out of a field. A total of six men were arrested after bodies of the sisters were found hanging from a tree.

291.title: 3 empty gun cartridges found at RSS shakha venue in Ludhiana
291.article_body: An FIR has been registered after three empty cartridges of a 32 bore weapon were found on Wednesday from Shaheedi Park in Ludhiana, an RSS shakha venue, police said. Some miscreants indulged in hooliganism on Tuesday night and one of them may have opened fire, according to police. The cartridges were recovered by RSS volunteers who were cleaning the premises.

292.title: 2 women tell Thane man his house has evil spirits; cheat him of ₹15 lakh
292.article_body: A 79-year-old man in Thane was cheated of ₹15.87 lakh after he was told by two women that evil spirits had invaded his house. The women made the senior citizen, who was living alone, give them the money between July and September by suggesting certain rituals, police said. The man approached the police and a case was registered on Tuesday.

293.title: GST collection may cross ₹1.5 lakh crore from Oct: Revenue Secy
293.article_body: The Goods and Services Tax (GST) collection may top the ₹1.5-lakh-crore-mark from October, Revenue Secretary Tarun Bajaj said on Wednesday. "The revenue that we'll collect in October...I'm sure from that month onwards the CBIC on a regular basis shall deliver ₹1.5 trillion revenue for the government," Bajaj said. The government collected ₹1.43 lakh crore in revenue from GST in August.

294.title: 6 roads worth ₹1.12 crore to be laid in Hyderabad
294.article_body: Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) Mayor Vijayalaxmi Gadwal inaugurated the project to lay six roads worth ₹1.12 crore in Hyderabad's Khairatabad. Speaking at the inauguration, the Mayor said that quality of the works being executed must be maintained. Additionally, the GHMC will also install 94 Pelican signals at key locations with push-button option for pedestrians to cross safely.

295.title: Gurugram resident arrested after man loses ₹1.4 lakh to crypto scam
295.article_body: A hearing and speech impaired man was arrested in Gurugram on Wednesday for cheating people in a cryptocurrency scam. Sanjeev Singh used to divert the cheated money to a US-based woman named Diana, police said. The arrest was made following the complaint of a man who allegedly lost ₹1.4 lakh after Diana lured him to invest in cryptocurrency.

296.title: MP serial killer who murdered 4 guards kept in isolation as inmates fear him
296.article_body: An 18-year-old serial killer, who has been accused of killing 4 security guards, has been kept in isolation in MP's Sagar central jail as other inmates fear him, an official said on Thursday. When he takes a bath, jail wardens remain nearby and his plate is taken back immediately after he finishes eating, said Jail Superintendent Rakesh Bhangre.

297.title: Fire breaks out in Cooper hospital's godown in Mumbai
297.article_body: A fire reportedly broke out in the godown of Mumbai's Dr R N Cooper Hospital on Thursday evening. As reported by ANI, the fire department confirmed no casualties were reported in the incident. The fire was brought under control, the fire department added. Cooper hospital is a government hospital located in Juhu.

298.title: Goa to organise 'Clean Coast, Safe Sea' program on Sept 17
298.article_body: The Goa government will organise a beach cleanliness drive on September 17, officials said on Thursday. The program titled 'Clean Coast, Safe Sea' will start at 8 am on International Coastal Cleanup Day. "Goa, being a tourist state famous for Sun, Sand and Sea, it's important to keep the beaches clean and safe for the tourists," CM Sawant tweeted.

299.title: Nurses at BMC-run Kasturba Hospital protest, demand 8 weekly-offs a month
299.article_body: Nurses at BMC-run Kasturba Gandhi Hospital in Mumbai held a protest on Thursday, demanding eight weekly-offs every month. "There's too much workload where nurses work round the clock," Pradeep Govind Narkar, Assistant General Secretary of Municipal Labour Union, said. This comes days after hospitals like Lokmanya Tilak Municipal General Hospital and KEM Hospital saw protests with similar demands.

300.title: 2 women pull hair, slap each other during fight at toll plaza in Maharashtra, video viral
300.article_body: A video has gone viral showing two women pulling each other's hair and slapping each other after a fight broke between them at a toll plaza in Maharashtra. One of the women was an employee at the toll plaza. In the video, other employees can be seen trying to stop the fight. The exact reason behind the fight isn't known.

301.title: KCR to inaugurate Adivasi Bhavan, Banjara bhavan in Hyd on Sept 17
301.article_body: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao will inaugurate Komaram Bheem Adivasi Bhavan and Sevalal Banjara building on September 17 in Hyderabad. The Sevalal Banjara building and Adivasi Bhavan were built at the cost of ₹24.43 crore and ₹24.68 crore respectively. Officials said the state government is implementing numerous welfare and development schemes to ensure comprehensive development of tribals.

302.title: 8 held for using Bluetooth earbuds to ‘cheat’ in railway exam in Noida
302.article_body: Police have arrested eight men for allegedly cheating in a railway recruitment examination using electronic devices, including wireless Bluetooth earphones, in Noida. The accused were arrested from an examination facility in Noida's Sector 62 during RRC Level-1 examination held on Tuesday. Police are "tracing call detail records to identify the person who was feeding the answers to the accused".

303.title: Pakistan's squad for T20 World Cup 2022 announced
303.article_body: Pakistan on Thursday announced their 15-man squad for the T20 World Cup 2022. Fast bowler Shaheen Afridi, who is currently recovering from an injury, has been included in the squad. The squad also features Shan Masood, who's yet to feature in a T20I, while Haider Ali was recalled to the side after last featuring in December 2021.

304.title: Road in Ahmedabad caves in, civic body's truck falls into the crack
304.article_body: A road in Ahmedabad's Juhapura caved in on Wednesday afternoon and led to Ahmedabad Municipal Corporation's (AMC) garbage truck falling into the crack. The area was barricaded after the truck was pulled out using a crane. This was the 92nd cave-in to have been reported in Ahmedabad after July 10. Of the 92 cave-ins, AMC claims to have repaired 84.

305.title: K'taka signed MoUs worth ₹1.3 lakh crore in renewable energy: CM
305.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai said on Thursday his state has inked memoranda of understanding worth ₹1.3 lakh crore in the renewable energy sector. "We are doing extensive work in...renewable energy. We will soon start producing hydrogen fuel," he said. The state wants to install renewable energy projects near the coast and industries along the Mumbai-Chennai corridor, he said.

306.title: Hindu Sena demands renaming of Delhi's Babar Road to Bhagwan Valmiki Marg
306.article_body: The Hindu Sena on Wednesday wrote to New Delhi Municipal Council (NDMC) demanding the renaming of Babar Road in the Bengali market to Bhagwan Valmiki Marg. The organisation said the road's name reminds people of atrocities done by Mughal ruler Babar on Hindus. "Everyone knows that Babar was an invader, an infiltrator, a jihadi terrorist," the Hindu Sena's letter stated.

307.title: Haryana CM pays ₹2,500 to woman whose pension stopped midway
307.article_body: Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar has given ₹2,500 from his own pocket to an elderly woman who complained that her pension was stopped after records allegedly showed her as dead, officials said. Khattar directed officials to restore the pension of all eligible beneficiaries whose pension was stopped due to improper data verification. He was addressing Jan Samvad grievance redressal programme.

308.title: ₹110-crore misappropriated in Bengaluru bank: State Co-op Minister
308.article_body: An audit of Bengaluru-based Shushruti Souharda Sahakara Bank Niyamita has revealed ₹110 crore misappropriation from its deposits, State Minister of Co-Operation ST Somashekar said at the Legislative Council. “However, in its reply, the department said that the bank cannot be listed as bankrupt,” Somashekar said. At the time of audit, the bank had recorded ₹180.77 crore in received deposits.

309.title: Odisha woman shot dead while trying to save husband from giving 'hafta'
309.article_body: A 45-year-old woman in Odisha's Nuapada was allegedly shot dead on Wednesday night while trying to save her husband from an armed youth asking for 'hafta' (extortion money). The inebriated youth threatened to kill the man if he failed to pay ₹10,000 as 'hafta'. A fire tender took the woman to the hospital as no ambulances were available.

310.title: BJP 'gifts' 5 autos to Kejriwal after Guj police stop him from riding in an auto
310.article_body: Delhi BJP MLAs on Thursday reached CM Arvind Kejriwal's residence to "gift" him five autorickshaws, days after he had an argument with Gujarat Police after they tried to stop him from travelling in an auto. Kejriwal has a convoy of 27 vehicles and 200 security personnel, but he enacted drama by travelling in an auto, said BJP's Ramvir Singh Bidhuri.

311.title: Mental strength as important as physical fitness in MMA: Ritu Phogat
311.article_body: Ahead of her fight at One Championship's Singapore event later this month, wrestler-turned-Mixed Martial Arts (MMA) fighter Ritu Phogat has said that being mentally strong is more important than being physically strong during matches. Talking about her last fight, which she lost, Ritu said, "The loss didn't affect me mentally...Winning and losing is a part and parcel of the game."

312.title: 38-year-old history-sheeter stabbed to death in Hyderabad
312.article_body: A group of people stabbed a 38-year-old history-sheeter to death in Hyderabad's Bahadurpura. The victim, identified as Babu Khan, was going on the road when he was stopped and attacked by a group of people with sharp weapons. Suspecting "old enmity", the police said that the victim's rivals might be involved in his murder.

313.title: B'luru municipality using 1984 map for its anti-encroachment drive
313.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) is using a map from 1984 to carry out its anti-encroachment drive, after heavy rains last week exposed the deficiencies in the city's drainage system. So far, the BBMP has demolished encroachments in Shantiniketan Layout, Munnekolalu and Challaghatta. BBMP Chief Commissioner Tushar Giri Nath has said all identified encroachments will be taken down.

314.title: Richa-Ali to host pre-wedding events in Delhi Gymkhana Club: Report
314.article_body: Richa Chadha and Ali Fazal will reportedly host their pre-wedding festivities in Delhi Gymkhana Club. As per reports, their pre-wedding functions will start from September 30. The actors are said to be wrapping up their respective projects by the end of next week. While Richa is working on Sanjay Leela Bhansali's 'Heeramandi', Ali will be seen in 'Mirzapur 3'.

315.title: Nadal's Aus Open final match gave me extra motivation: Iga Swiatek
315.article_body: World number one Iga Swiatek, who won the French Open and the US Open this season, has said Rafael Nadal's win at the 2022 Australian Open final against Daniil Medvedev gave her "extra motivation" and "inspired" her. In the match, Nadal was two sets down before he came back and defeated Medvedev to win his 21st Grand Slam singles title.

316.title: Harshest action to be taken against criminals: UP Dy CM on Lakhimpur incident
316.article_body: Following the Lakhimpur Kheri incident, where two minor Dalit sisters were allegedly raped and murdered, UP Deputy CM Keshav Prasad Maurya said this incident is sad and unfortunate. "Harshest action to be taken against all criminals. I'd expect the Opposition, whether Akhilesh Yadav, Priyanka Gandhi or Mayawati, that instead of politicising...console the family," Maurya added.

317.title: Connaught Place, Saket to soon get microbreweries, excise dept gives nod
317.article_body: Delhi's Connaught Place and Saket will soon get microbreweries serving draught beer after the excise department issued their licenses. According to officials, 10 microbreweries will be opened in Saket under the L-11 licence while CP will also get new microbreweries. Delhi people will get fresh beers from the first week of October, officials said.

318.title: PM should apologise for doing a fake sting if I'm not arrested by Mon: Sisodia
318.article_body: After BJP released a new sting video in connection with the Delhi liquor scam, AAP leader and Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia challenged the CBI to arrest him by Monday. "If the allegations are correct, they should arrest me by Monday. If not, the PM should apologise to me for this fake sting by Monday," Sisodia said in a tweet.

319.title: Very heavy rainfall warning issued for several states, list released
319.article_body: The IMD, in its latest bulletin, issued very heavy rainfall warning for several states. Very heavy rainfall is likely over Uttarakhand and Uttar Pradesh till September 17. Very heavy rainfall is also very likely over Goa and Maharashtra till tomorrow. Further, heavy rainfall is expected over Odisha on September 18 and 19.

320.title: Samsung to invest over $5 bn with aim of net zero emissions by 2050
320.article_body: Samsung Electronics will invest over $5.02 billion (7 trillion won) by 2030 towards environmental initiatives with an aim to make the company carbon neutral by 2050. It also plans to bolster the recycling of resources such as lithium and plastic. The chip and mobile maker said it joined a group of global corporations committed to 100% renewable energy called RE100.

321.title: Edtech firm upGrad acquires Centum Learning in share-swap deal
321.article_body: Edtech unicorn upGrad has acquired New Delhi-based corporate training solutions startup Centum Learning in a share-swap deal. After the transaction is completed, Bharti Enterprises, which owns Centum Learning, and its affiliates will join upGrad's cap table. Centum will continue to operate independently under Managing Director and CEO, Sanjay Bahl, the company said in a statement.

322.title: Billionaire Venture signs MoU with DBS Bank to fund startups
322.article_body: Billionaire Venture Incubation has signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with DBS Bank to facilitate equity investments in startups. The joint venture will earmark about $200 million to invest in over 150 startups across Tamil Nadu, Maharashtra and Karnataka, initially. The joint venture will be focusing on 16 verticals and will immediately focus on fintech and edtech, among others.

323.title: Tata-owned Air India aims 30% domestic market share in 5 years
323.article_body: In a bid to have a domestic market share of 30% and strengthen its international operations, Air India has put in place a transformation plan. The Tata-owned airline announced 'Vihaan.AI' with a detailed roadmap for the next five years with focus on growing its network and fleet. The airline is expected to soon induct 30 new wide-body and narrow-body aircraft.

324.title: Guj man mistakenly gets ₹11,677 cr in demat account, invests ₹2 cr in stocks
324.article_body: A bank glitch caused a man in Ahmedabad to receive ₹11,677 crore in his demat account for a few hours. The man said that out of this amount, he invested ₹2 crore in the stock market and booked a profit of ₹5 lakh but that same evening, Kotak Securities withdrew the amount. Kotak Securities is yet to comment on this.

325.title: Some people trying to give it different colour: Tejashwi on Begusarai firing
325.article_body: Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav while commenting on the Begusarai shooting incident said some people are trying to give it a different colour. "BJP…never does as it says, all they do is divide people and poison society," Yadav added. One person was killed and 11 others were injured in firing by bike-borne men at multiple locations in Begusarai on Tuesday.

326.title: Ready to cooperate: K'taka Congress chief Shivakumar on ED summons
326.article_body: Karnataka Congress chief DK Shivakumar was on Thursday summoned by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) in connection with a money laundering case. "I'm ready to cooperate but the timing of this summon and the harassment I'm put through, is coming in the way of discharging my constitutional and political duties," Shivakumar tweeted. Notably, the summons come amid Congress' 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'.

327.title: Assam govt asked to pay ₹25,000 to boy assaulted in police station
327.article_body: The National Human Rights Commission (NHRC) has ordered the Assam government to pay ₹25,000 to a 13-year-old boy who was beaten using a stick by an Assistant Sub-Inspector inside a police station. The incident happened in Morigaon district about six months ago. The rights body also asked the government to initiate prosecution proceedings against the suspended police officer.

328.title: PVR Limited shares fall 4.4% after reports of a block deal
328.article_body: PVR Limited shares dropped 4.4% to close at ₹1,844.5 on BSE on Thursday after reports of a block deal in which around 4.7 million shares or 7.7% stake changed hands. The shares were reportedly traded at an average price of ₹1,892 apiece. Details of buyers and sellers are not known yet. The stock opened 2.3% lower at ₹1,882 a share.

329.title: Vedanta-Foxconn project going to Guj is attack on Maha's prestige: Shiv Sena
329.article_body: The Shiv Sena said that the semiconductor project of Vedanta-Foxconn going to Gujarat is an attack on Maharashtra's prestige. When BJP's Devendra Fadnavis was CM from 2014-19, the GIFT City project was handed over to Gujarat and current CM Eknath Shinde similarly allowed the semiconductor plant to slip away, Shiv Sena said in its mouthpiece 'Saamana'.

330.title: India's Russian oil imports rose to 18% of total crude bought in July
330.article_body: With Russian petroleum crude imports worth $2.88 billion in July, India's oil imports from Russia surged to nearly 18% of its total petroleum crude imports, Commerce Ministry data showed. In June, oil imported from Russia was 16.8% of total petroleum crude imports. Imports of crude oil, products and petroleum surged to $17.7 billion in August, provisional data for trade showed.

331.title: Why was Nora Fatehi summoned by Delhi Police in ₹200-crore money laundering case?
331.article_body: Actress Nora Fatehi, who appeared before Delhi Police in a ₹200-crore money laundering case on Thursday, was questioned over her links to conman Sukesh Chandrasekhar and actress Jacqueline Fernandez, officials said. "Both the actresses were introduced to Sukesh by one Pinky Irani. She will be questioned alongside Irani," said an officer. Police clarified that Nora Fatehi is not an accused.

332.title: BPCL divestment plan not on the table as of now: Union Minister Puri
332.article_body: The divestment plan for Bharat Petroleum Corporation Limited is not on the table as of now as it can't find an adequate number of bidders for the process, Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri said. The Centre had in August said that it would decide on re-initiating BPCL's strategic sale process based on a review of the situation in due course.

333.title: Pune Zilla Parishad begins leprosy, TB eradication drive
333.article_body: The health department of Pune Zilla Parishad has started a leprosy and tuberculosis eradication drive. During the drive, ASHA workers, male volunteers and health workers will carry out doorstep checks for symptoms and spread awareness. Launched under the National Leprosy Eradication Programme (NLEP), the programme will cover over 5 lakh people in rural and urban areas of the district.

334.title: Culprits should be hanged: Father of Lakhimpur rape, murder victims
334.article_body: The father of the two Dalit sisters who were allegedly raped and murdered in Uttar Pradesh's  Lakhimpur Kheri has stated that the culprits should be hanged. "My daughters were abducted from the house and...were raped and murdered. I demand justice," he added. After the sisters were found hanging from a tree, villagers carried out a march and blocked a road.

335.title: Sudanese woman held at Hyderabad airport, gold worth ₹14 lakh seized
335.article_body: Customs officials at Hyderabad's Rajiv Gandhi International Airport apprehended a female Sudanese national who was smuggling gold and seized 272.98 grams of gold worth ₹14.15 lakh. The woman passenger arrived from Dubai by flight EK 524 and was trying to smuggle gold in the form of paste by concealing it in her rectum, Hyderabad Customs tweeted.

336.title: CBI searches 6 locations in Delhi, Kolkata in WB SSC scam case
336.article_body: CBI on Thursday conducted searches at six locations in Delhi and Kolkata in connection with the West Bengal School Service Commission (SSC) scam, officials said. The searches were conducted at the premises of a software company. Records were allegedly manipulated in the appointment of teachers following which the role of the company came into the limelight.

337.title: Kohli should be opening in T20 WC, it just gives the right balance: Parthiv
337.article_body: Ex-India wicketkeeper-batter Parthiv Patel has said Virat Kohli should open in the upcoming T20 World Cup. "It's very clear. [It] was clear that Virat should be opening in Asia Cup...It just gives the right balance," he stated. "If Rohit and Kohli can play till the first six overs...more often than not they will get India to around fifty," added Parthiv.

338.title: 22-yr-old biker crushed by dumper making an illegal U-turn in Mumbai
338.article_body: A 22-year-old biker from Mumbai, Prafful Sanjay Bhosale, was run over by a dumper supplying material for the Coastal Road project on Tuesday. Police said that the overloaded dumper made an illegal U-turn on Khan Abdul Gaffar Khan road at Worli. "Due to the sudden U-turn, Bhosale directly came under the front wheel of the dumper," a police official said.

339.title: Pak collected $40 million to build a 'mega dam' & spent $63 million on its ads
339.article_body: Touted to be Pakistan's "mega dam" that would prevent flooding issues, it has been revealed that $40 million was raised from the public for Diamer-Bhasha Dam's construction and $63 million was spent on its advertising while the construction remains unfinished. The army gave up a portion of soldiers' salaries to contribute to this project and the cricket team also participated.

340.title: Will feed you in morning and noon, you just study: Stalin tells students
340.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin launched first phase of a state-wide free breakfast programme for students in classes one to five. "We see it as a government duty rather than a cost to the exchequer," he said. "We will feed you in the morning and at noon...You may please study, study, study without any worries," Stalin told students.

341.title: Might even trade Mumbai: Sena on CM Shinde amid ₹1,54,000 cr deal row
341.article_body: The Shiv Sena on Thursday said the mega semiconductor project of Vedanta-Foxconn worth  ₹1,54,000 crore going to Gujarat was an attack on Maharashtra's "prestige". One day, the Eknath Shinde-led Maharashtra government "might even trade Mumbai", said the editorial in the Shiv Sena mouthpiece 'Saamana'.

342.title: Dalit man beaten for drinking water from pot for upper castes in Raj
342.article_body: A Dalit man was allegedly beaten by a group of men for drinking water from a pot meant for upper-caste people kept outside a grocery shop in Rajasthan's Jaisalmer on Tuesday. The victim, who was accompanied by his wife, was struck with iron rods and sticks, said police. Four people have been booked under the SC/ST Act.

343.title: PMC floats tender for construction of 350-bed hospital in Warje
343.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has floated a tender for the construction and management of a 350-bed hospital in Warje on a public-private partnership model. According to officials, the multi-speciality hospital would be constructed at an estimated cost of ₹350 crore. It will have medical technology of international standards and will promote medical tourism as well, officials said.

344.title: 35-yr-old relative killed 8-month pregnant woman in Hyd for revenge: Police
344.article_body: A week after a 32-year-old pregnant woman was allegedly murdered at her home in Hyderabad's Kondapur, police have arrested her relative, a 35-year-old man from Andhra Pradesh. The accused had a grudge against the victim's family for reportedly instigating his wife to complain of domestic violence and dowry harassment to the police a month ago, police said.

345.title: Tiger kills man in MP's Balaghat, villagers told to stay indoors
345.article_body: A 22-year-old man was mauled to death by a tiger in Madhya Pradesh's Balaghat district on Tuesday. The incident occurred when Phool Singh Madavi had gone to graze his livestock in the forest along with four other villagers. Following the incident, forest department officials requested the people of Pandrapani village to stay indoors and avoid venturing into the forest.

346.title: Ayan, Ranbir visit Somnath Temple days after 'Brahmastra' release
346.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor, along with Ayan Mukerji, sought blessings at Somnath Temple on Thursday. Sharing a picture on Instagram, Ayan wrote, "I'd told myself I would come here after 'Brahmastra' releases, and am so happy and energised that we made it here." Earlier, Ranbir was stopped from visiting Ujjain's Mahakaleshwar Temple by Bajrang Dal workers over his remarks on consuming beef.
