347.title: No decision yet: Samsung as reports claim it's returning to Russia
347.article_body: Samsung on Thursday said nothing has been decided after media reports claimed that the company was returning to the Russian market, six months after suspending shipments over invasion of Ukraine. Reports had claimed that Samsung could restart sales in Russia in October. It was also reported that Samsung would resume supplies of equipment to retailers and restart its online store.

348.title: Bengaluru Police nab interstate gang that targets lone travellers
348.article_body: The City Crime Branch (CCB) of Bengaluru Police have caught an inter-state gang that allegedly robbed people of money and valuables at knife-point. The main targets of the gang were lone travellers between states, the police said. Valuables worth ₹50 lakh including 619 mobile phones, two cars, one two-wheeler and one laptop have been seized, the police added.

349.title: BEST warns consumers against fake messages after several trapped
349.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Electric Supply and Transport (BEST) has warned its consumers not to respond to any fraudulent messages regarding bill payments purportedly on behalf of the undertaking. The authorities directed residents to avoid any message other than from 'BESTSM'. The warning comes after many customers complained that they received fraudulent SMS and many got cheated as well.

350.title: Drunk driver rams car into 66-year-old man in Mumbai's Vasai
350.article_body: A 36-year-old man, who was reportedly driving drunk, rammed into a 66-year-old man on a scooter in Mumbai's Vasai on Tuesday. According to police, the man was flung 10 feet in air and sustained severe injuries to his leg and hand after crashing on road. The accused, who fled the spot, was driving back from an alcohol party, police said.

351.title: Maharashtra CM calls PM Modi over Vedanta-Foxconn facility, says PM promised big projects
351.article_body: Following Vedanta-Foxconn's decision to set up a semiconductor facility in Gujarat, Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde called PM Narendra Modi. "I've requested PM Modi that there is a need to give a boost to industries here since there is scope, infrastructure and potential," he said. PM promised that the Centre would help bring "big projects" to Maharashtra, Shinde added.

352.title: Afghanistan announce squad for T20 World Cup 2022, include 10 players aged 23 or under
352.article_body: Afghanistan on Thursday announced their 15-member squad for T20 World Cup 2022. Mohammad Nabi will lead the team, while Najibullah Zadran has been named his deputy. The squad includes as many as 10 players who are aged 23 or under. Salim Safi, a 20-year-old fast bowler, has received his maiden international call-up.

353.title: Special plane to bring 8 cheetahs to India from Namibia, pic released
353.article_body: The High Commission of India in Windhoek, Namibia shared the picture of the special plane that will bring eight cheetahs to India from Namibia. "A special bird touches down in the Land of the Brave to carry goodwill ambassadors to the Land of the Tiger," the caption read. The huge plane has face of a tiger painted on its front.

354.title: I told Babar 'If you don't think I'm needed anymore, tell me': Shoaib Malik
354.article_body: Amid debate over Pakistan's middle-order and omission of Shoaib Malik from their Asia Cup squad, an old video of the all-rounder's interview has gone viral. In the interview, Shoaib revealed that Babar had asked him if he wanted to retire. "[I said], 'If you want me to play...I'll'...Babar said, 'I'll let you know which series you'll play'," said Malik.

355.title: Govt panel calls for new regulatory body for classifying online games: Report
355.article_body: A panel of central government officials said in its report that India should create a regulatory body to classify online games as skill or chance-based and to introduce rules to block prohibited formats, Reuters reported. The report further states that India also needs a new law to provide regulatory flexibility to the government. Union IT Ministry will finalise the report.

356.title: G Khan booked for singing 'Peg Mote', 'Choli Ke Peeche' at Ganesh Visarjan event in Punjab
356.article_body: Singer G Khan has been booked for hurting religious sentiments by allegedly singing 'inappropriate' songs at a Ganesh Visarjan event in Punjab's Ludhiana. G Khan sang songs such as 'Peg Mote Mote Whisky Wale' and 'Choli Ke Peeche Kya Hai' at the gathering. The police also booked Honey Bedi, the son of ex-BJP MLA Harish Bedi, who organised the event.

357.title: Dalit sisters' family rejects police's 'friendship' claim in Lakhimpur rape case
357.article_body: The family of the two Dalit minor sisters, who were raped and subsequently murdered in UP's Lakhimpur Kheri, rejected the police's claim that the girls were friends with the men who carried out the crime. "Our mother identifies three of the men. But we don't know who the rest are," the victims' brother said. Police have arrested six people.

358.title: Man falls on tracks while boarding moving train in UP, coaches pass over him
358.article_body: A video shows a 28-year-old man lying on railway tracks as a train passes over him in UP's Bhadohi. The incident took place when the man fell on the tracks while boarding the moving train. He reportedly suffered head injury and lost his finger in the incident. Video shows blood on the man's head and hands after he got up.

359.title: Kazakhstan to change name of capital from Nur-sultan back to Astana
359.article_body: Kazakhstan President Kassym-Jomart Tokayev has agreed to restore the name of the Kazakhstan capital from Nur-Sultan to Astana. The city was renamed Nur-Sultan three years ago by Tokayev to honour his predecessor Nursultan Nazarbayev after he stepped down in 2019. Tokayev's spokesman, Ruslan Zheliban, said the President agreed to restore the name after an initiative by a group of MPs.

360.title: Exposes govt's claims in matter of women's safety: Mayawati on Lakhimpur incident
360.article_body: Reacting to the alleged rape and murder of two minor Dalit sisters in UP's Lakhimpur Kheri, BSP chief Mayawati on Thursday said criminals are roaming fearlessly in the state because the priorities of the government are wrong. "This incident strongly exposes the claims of the government in the matter of law and order and women's safety," Mayawati tweeted.

361.title: Pogba's elder brother taken into police custody over extortion of Juve midfielder
361.article_body: French authorities have reportedly taken Mathias Pogba, the elder brother of Juventus midfielder Paul Pogba, into custody over the organised armed extortion of the former Manchester United footballer. Pogba has alleged that an organised gang, involving his brother, had demanded €13-million from him. According to reports, three other people are also in custody in connection with the case.

362.title: Using female police officer to stop me part of bigger ploy: BJP's Suvendu
362.article_body: BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari said using a female police officer to stop him during BJP's march to West Bengal secretariat was part of a "bigger ploy". This comes after a video went viral wherein Adhikari was seen telling the officer, "Do not touch my body. You're female." "Had I retaliated...they would've got a chance to defame...and book me," Adhikari added.

363.title: K'taka man rolls on road to protest against potholes; video emerges
363.article_body: A social worker named Nityananda rolled on a stretch of road to protest against potholes in Karnataka's Udupi on Tuesday. He began his protest by breaking a coconut and offering 'aarti' to potholes of Indrali bridge. A video showed Nityananda, clad in a saffron kurta, rolling on a potholed and muddy road with the sound of drumbeats in the background.

364.title: Work & personal life is separate: Shruti on working with partner Santanu
364.article_body: Shruti Haasan spoke about collaborating with boyfriend and visual artiste Santanu Hazarika for her single 'She is a Hero'. "I don't take his artistry for granted ever. To have him be a part of this project and in the way in which he lent himself is brilliant," she said. Shruti said for them, their "work and personal life is separate".

365.title: Tesla sued in US for deceptive advertising of its Full Self-Driving tech
365.article_body: Tesla was sued in a US court on Wednesday for deceptively advertising its Full Self-Driving and Autopilot technology since 2016 as fully functioning or "just around the corner", despite knowing it didn't work. The plaintiff, Briggs Matsko, said Tesla did this to "generate excitement" about its vehicles. "Tesla...yet to produce anything even remotely approaching a fully self-driving car," he said.

366.title: Delhi govt to organise blood donation camps at over 50 spots on Sep 28
366.article_body: To mark the birth anniversary of revolutionary freedom fighter Bhagat Singh, the Delhi government will organise blood donation camps at over 50 locations in Delhi on September 28, Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal said on Thursday. Adding that Bhagat Singh has inspired generations of youth, he appealed to youths across the country to donate blood as a tribute to him.

367.title: Fed up of husband's extramarital affair, woman kills self in Pune
367.article_body: A woman died by suicide at her parent's house in Pune after being fed up of her husband's extramarital affair and harassment. Police investigation has found that the victim was harassed, beaten up and starved for many days by her husband and was forced to leave his house. Police have booked her husband, who runs a jewellery shop in Delhi.

368.title: Nora Fatehi appears before Delhi Police for questioning in ₹200-cr money laundering case
368.article_body: Actress Nora Fatehi today appeared before the Economic Offences Wing (EOW) of Delhi Police in connection with the ₹200-crore money laundering case involving jailed conman Sukesh Chandrashekhar. This comes a day after the Delhi Police EOW officials summoned actor Jacqueline Fernandez in the same case. Jacqueline was grilled for over 8 hours and was given a list of 100 questions.

369.title: Murderous thug: Amit Malviya on TMC MP's 'police could've fired bullets' remark
369.article_body: BJP leader Amit Malviya on Thursday criticised TMC MP Abhishek Banerjee for his "police could've fired bullets instead of using teargas" remark in connection with BJP's 'Nabanna Cholo' march. "This murderous thug is more than just Mamata Banerjee's nephew," Malviya said. "He holds unconstitutional sway over her government," he added. Abhishek Banerjee had said that police chose to show restraint.

370.title: Truly in awe: Halle on Black girls' reactions to 'The Little Mermaid' teaser
370.article_body: Hollywood actress Halle Bailey is in "awe" about how young Black girls are reacting to the teaser of her film, 'The Little Mermaid'. Re-sharing a compilation video, which features some young girls' reactions to the teaser, Bailey tweeted, "People have been sending these reactions to me all weekend and I'm in truly in awe. This means the world to me."

371.title: Dutch students create 3D-printed EV that captures more carbon than it emits
371.article_body: A team of students at Netherlands' Eindhoven University of Technology has created an electric vehicle (EV) which captures more carbon than it emits. Called ZEM (zero emission mobility), it runs on a lithium-ion battery pack and most of its parts are 3D-printed from recycled plastics. ZEM can capture up to two kg carbon dioxide (CO2) over 20,000 miles of driving.

372.title: Gurugram woman falls out of moving auto while fighting off phone snatcher
372.article_body: A 40-year-old woman sustained serious injuries after falling out of a moving auto-rickshaw while fighting off a biker who tried to snatch her mobile phone, police said. "Gurugram is a very unsafe city. I was lucky no other vehicle was behind the auto, otherwise I would have been crushed," the victim said in a statement.

373.title: Nearly 1 in 5 news videos on TikTok contain misinformation: Report
373.article_body: TikTok search results for prominent news topics like Russia-Ukraine war, COVID-19 and climate change contain misinformation, according to a report by NewsGuard. Researchers found that nearly one of the five news videos automatically suggested by the platform had misinformation. "We don't allow harmful misinformation...and we'll remove it from the platform," TikTok said in response to the report.

374.title: 13-yr-old kidnapped, gang-raped in Hyderabad; 2 arrested
374.article_body: A 13-year-old girl was allegedly kidnapped and gang-raped in Hyderabad's Old City by two persons. As per the victim's mother, the girl went out to buy medicine when the accused forcibly pushed her in the car and later drugged and raped her and left the girl near her house after two days. The two alleged offenders have been detained.

375.title: Don't scream, then you'll say actors have bad manners: Taapsee to reporter in viral video
375.article_body: A video has gone viral showing actress Taapsee Pannu asking a reporter to not scream while asking her questions during media interaction at OTT Play Awards 2022. "Don't scream, then you will say that actors have bad manners," Taapsee was heard saying in the video. Taapsee was then heard asking the reporter to do homework before asking her questions.

376.title: Special status to all backward states if we form govt: Nitish
376.article_body: Special category status will be given to all backward states if the Opposition parties form the government at the Centre, said Bihar CM Nitish Kumar on Thursday. "There is no reason why it cannot be done," Kumar told journalists at an event in Patna. Notably, Kumar recently met with leaders of several political parties seeking to unite the Opposition.

377.title: B'luru woman, daughter kill selves after family refuse to give away dog
377.article_body: A Bengaluru-based woman and her 13-year-old daughter allegedly died by suicide after her husband and in-laws refused to give their pet dog away for her health concern. Reportedly, the 36-year-old woman had breathing problems and skin allergy and a doctor had advised her to stay away from dogs. Police have registered a case of abetment to suicide against her husband.

378.title: Standing room tickets for India-Pakistan T20 WC 2022 match sold out within minutes: ICC
378.article_body: The standing room tickets for India-Pakistan T20 World Cup 2022 match were snapped up within minutes of going on sale, the ICC said. This comes days after the general tickets for the match were sold within five minutes. An official re-sale platform will be launched closer to the event, where fans can exchange tickets at face value, the ICC added.

379.title: Ben van Beurden to step down as Shell CEO after 10 years
379.article_body: Shell CEO Ben van Beurden will step down from his role at the end of 2022 after nearly 10 years. He will be succeeded by Wael Sawan, the firm's head of gas and renewables. Beurden, who joined Shell in 1983, will remain as adviser to the board until June 30, 2023, after which he will leave the company.

380.title: Great try but not a successful one: Erica on 'Brahmastra'
380.article_body: Actress Erica Fernandes recently shared her opinion on 'Brahmastra' and said that while the film is a "great try", it isn't a successful one. She said she wished the makers had put more efforts into training the actors for this kind of filmmaking. "Everyone learns from their mistakes and I hope some good comes out of this too," she added.

381.title: Royal Enfield maker Eicher Motors enters ₹1-trillion m-cap club
381.article_body: Shares of Royal Enfield parent, Eicher Motors Limited, surged by 41% so far this year and the firm became India's fifth auto company to join the ₹1 trillion market capital club. Eicher Motors' stock hit a record high of ₹3,659.45 a share on Thursday and gained nearly 3.31% from its previous close with a market cap of ₹1.01 trillion.

382.title: 5 killed, 12 injured as bus falls into gorge in J&K's Rajouri
382.article_body: As many as five persons were killed and 12 others were injured when the bus they were travelling in fell into a gorge in J&K's Rajouri. The bus was on its way to Jammu from Surankote Poonch. "Deeply pained by the news of another tragic road accident in Rajouri at Deri Ralyote (Manjakote)," Jammu Mayor Chander Mohan Gupta tweeted.

383.title: OnePlus launches OnePlus 10R Prime Blue Edition in India
383.article_body: OnePlus has announced the OnePlus 10R Prime Blue Edition in India. The smartphone offers a 3-month Prime membership at no extra cost, celebrating the long-standing partnership with Amazon. The smartphone comes equipped with 80W SUPERVOOC charging, a 6.7-inch 120Hz AMOLED display with a 1080p resolution, HDR10+ support, OxygenOS 12.1 and more.

384.title: Apple website down for some users ahead of iPhone 14 series sale on Sept 16
384.article_body: Apple’s website is down for some users across the world. Several people took to Twitter to share screenshots of the website which either showed a '403 error' or was unable to fully load the images. This comes a day ahead of the sale of its three new iPhones- iPhone 14, iPhone 14 Pro and iPhone 14 Pro Max.

385.title: Bengaluru's tech park admits to encroaching on stormwater drains
385.article_body: Bengaluru's Bagmane World Technology Centre, which includes companies like Accenture, Boeing and DELL, admitted to encroaching on stormwater drains in east Bengaluru. "Yes, we have covered the storm water drain with slabs," Bagmane's general manager said. "We did that only to stop back flow of water from Mahadevapura lake...Main culprit here is Puravankara Purvaridge Villas," the manager added.

386.title: Had some chats with McCullum, he has been, 'stop fearing getting out': Pope
386.article_body: England batter Ollie Pope has said he has enjoyed batting at number three in Tests with coach Brendon McCullum helping him to overcome his fear of losing wicket in the longest format of the game. "I think I was almost putting myself under too much pressure and fear of getting out was probably getting a bit too much," stated Pope.

387.title: 7 arrested for setting police vehicle on fire during Nabanna protest in WB
387.article_body: West Bengal's Kolkata Police on Wednesday night arrested seven people accused of setting a police vehicle on fire on Tuesday during BJP's 'Nabanna Abhiyan' protest. "Those arrested include the one who was carrying the lighter and had started burning the vehicle," police said. Notably, over 112 people have been arrested in connection with the violence during BJP's march.

388.title: 6 Mumbai locals plying on intervening night of Sept 15-16 cancelled
388.article_body: Six Mumbai local trains will remain cancelled for four hours on the intervening night of September 15 and 16 due to maintenance work at Delisle Road Overbridge in Lower Parel, Western Railway (WR) officials informed. "This will lead to Borivali-Churchgate slow local departing from Borivali at 00.30 hrs (midnight) running as extra fast local between Andheri–Bandra–Dadar–Mumbai Central," WR said.

389.title: Russian President Putin's limousine attacked in assassination attempt: Reports
389.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin's limousine was attacked in an assassination attempt, according to reports citing information from the General GVR Telegram channel. Putin's limousine was reportedly hit by a "loud bang" on its left front wheel followed by heavy smoke. In 2017, Putin publicly disclosed that he has survived at least five assassination attempts.

390.title: Concrete slab falls off flyover in Mumbai's Bandra, causes panic
390.article_body: A concrete slab fell off a flyover in Mumbai's Bandra area on Wednesday, causing panic among the residents. It was one of the many slabs placed to hold beautification pots on the Mahim connector. Although no one was injured, the residents expressed concern about potential accidents. Following the incident, the authorities decided to remove all such slabs from the flyover.

391.title: What is Ethereum Merge, an energy saving upgrade that has been completed?
391.article_body: Ethereum, the second-largest blockchain network, has completed a massive upgrade that will help the blockchain run efficiently while adding new features. Called the Merge, it represents the Ethereum network's shift to proof-of-stake (PoS), its new system to authenticate transactions by replacing proof-of-work (PoW). Merge will result in a 99.95% reduction in Ethereum's energy consumption.

392.title: Why heinous crimes against women rising in UP?: Priyanka on Lakhimpur incident
392.article_body: Reacting to the alleged rape and murder of two minor Dalit sisters in UP's Lakhimpur Kheri, Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra asked, "Why are heinous crimes against women increasing in UP?" Priyanka tweeted, "The killings of the two sisters in Lakhimpur is heartbreaking…Law and order in the state doesn’t improve by giving false advertisements in newspapers and TV everyday."

393.title: Can't expect women's safety from those facilitating rapists' release: Rahul
393.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Thursday criticised BJP over the kidnapping and murder of two Dalit girls in Uttar Pradesh's Lakhimpur Kheri district and described the incident as "very disturbing". "Women's safety cannot be expected from those facilitating the release of rapists," Rahul tweeted while referring to the release of 11 convicts in the Bilkis Bano gang-rape case.

394.title: MI Cape Town name Simon Katich as head coach, Hashim Amla as batting coach
394.article_body: Former Australia cricketer Simon Katich has been appointed as the head coach of MI Cape Town for the inaugural season of SA20. Katich will be joined by former South Africa batter Hashim Amla as the team's batting coach and ex-New Zealand cricketer James Pamment as fielding coach. Notably, Pamment is also the fielding coach of IPL franchise MI.

395.title: Nick Cannon welcomes his 9th child while expecting two babies with 2 other women
395.article_body: Actor Nick Cannon has welcomed his ninth child and his first with model LaNisha Cole. In June, Cannon confirmed that he is expecting a child with Abby De La Rosa. Last month, Cannon, who welcomed a baby with model Bre Tiesi in July, took to social media to announce that he is expecting his third child with model Brittany Bell.

396.title: Qatar school shut after 4-yr-old Indian girl dies in bus
396.article_body: A private school in Qatar has been closed after the death of a four-year-old Indian student, Qatar's Education Ministry said. The move comes after an investigation revealed negligence among its workers, "who were subjected to...most severe penalties", it added. Minsa Jacob, who hailed from Kerala, died on her birthday after being left inside her school bus for over four hours.

397.title: Dr Anahita, driver of car that crashed killing Mistry, undergoes pelvic reconstruction
397.article_body: Dr Anahita Pandole, who was driving the car that crashed into a divider killing former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry and injuring her and her husband, was operated for pelvic reconstruction in Mumbai. Notably, Dr Peter V Giannoudis, Chairman of Academic Department of Trauma and Orthopaedic Surgery at University of Leeds, UK, was flown to Mumbai for his expert advice.

398.title: Woman with toy gun breaks into bank to get her trapped savings in Beirut; pics viral
398.article_body: Amid the economic crisis in Lebanon, a woman carrying a toy pistol broke into a Beirut bank, taking $13,000 from her trapped savings. Sali Hafez said she needed the money to fund her sister's cancer treatment. Hafez repeatedly visited the bank to ask for her money and was told she could only receive $200 a month in Lebanese pounds.

399.title: Sonam is going to make for a really fun mom: Swara Bhasker
399.article_body: Actress Swara Bhasker said Sonam Kapoor and Anand Ahuja are going "to make great parents". She said Sonam is "going to make for a really fun mom". Adding that she's a "funny person", Swara added she is sure that Sonam will have many stories to tell about her son. Sonam gave birth to a baby boy on August 20.

400.title: 2 terrorists involved in migrant's death killed in encounter in J&K
400.article_body: Two terrorists, involved in the death of a migrant labourer from West Bengal, were killed in encounter with Jammu and Kashmir Police in the Nowgam area of Srinagar on Wednesday night. According to police, the terrorists were affiliated with the outfit Ansar Ghazwat-ul-Hind (AGuH). An AK rifle, two pistols and other war-like stores were also recovered from the spot.
